Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti of Aset with a blue lappet wig with white braided ends, a light brown carved face with red and black details, representations of red ear-studs, red lines on the neck representing creases, a green collar depicted covering the hands, the body is white, the legs are inscribed with a central column of black painted hieroglyphs on a yellow ground with a black border and a red outer border representing a sash(?).
Condition: fair - split, paint on the head worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
